meanings.definition: To give a name to at baptism.
meanings.sent1: The baby was christened with the name Emily during the baptism ceremony.
meanings.sent2: They christened their newborn daughter Lily at the church.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was christened with the name 'Fluffy' at the doggy baptism event.
meanings.sent4: The ship was christened 'Ocean Explorer' as it set sail for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The town christened the new park 'Sunshine Meadows' to bring joy to the community.

meanings.definition: To name or dedicate (something) formally or officially.
meanings.sent1: The school christened the new library in honor of the beloved principal.
meanings.sent2: They christened the newly built bridge 'Unity Bridge' to symbolize connection.
meanings.sent3: The chef christened his latest creation 'Gourmet Delight' to attract foodies.
meanings.sent4: The author christened her book series 'Adventure Chronicles' for young readers.
meanings.sent5: The city council christened the renovated square 'Harmony Plaza' for all to enjoy.
